snippet: The medical debt-collection company, the subjection of an investigation by the Minnesota attorney general into its practices, announced higher quarterly earnings on Wednesday.
abstract: Medical debt-collection company Accretive Health, facing accusations by the Minnesota attorney general over using overly aggressive tactics, lowers its 2012 earnings estimate to $960 million to $992 million, down from $1.09 billion to $1.12 billion; reports first-quarter profit of $1.5 million, up from $160,000 in the year-ago quarter; revenue rose 55 percent to $253.7 million.
lead_paragraph: The medical debt-collection company, the subjection of an investigation by the Minnesota attorney general into its practices, announced higher quarterly earnings on Wednesday.

headline.seo: After Questions on Tactics, Accretive Cuts Forecast
headline.main: After Questions on Tactics, Accretive Cuts Forecast
headline.print_headline: After Questions on Tactics, Accretive Cuts Forecast
